bowl.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a wide round container that is open at the top, used to hold liquids, food, flowers etc
a soup/salad/cereal etc bowl (=a bowl to eat or serve soup, salad etc from)
bowl.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Mix all the ingredients thoroughly in a large bowl.
Beat the butter in a mixing bowl until creamy and soft.
bowl.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the amount of something contained in a bowl
bowl.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an outdoor game played on grass, in which you try to roll big balls as near as possible to a small ball
bowl.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a special game in American football played by the best teams after the normal playing season
bowl.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a ball that you use in the game of bowls
bowl.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: the part of an object such as a spoon, pipe, toilet etc that is shaped like a bowl
bowl.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a large stadium shaped like a bowl, where people go to watch special events such as sports games or music concerts
bowl.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: These work well as pasta or cereal bowls.
There are some apples in the fruit bowl if you want one.
Put the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl.
She put the strawberries in a glass serving bowl.
bowl.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to roll a ball along a surface when you are playing the game of bowls
bowl.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to throw a ball at the batsman (=the person who hits the ball) in cricket
bowl.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to make a batsman have to leave the field by throwing a ball so that it hits the wicket behind him
bowl.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to travel along very quickly and smoothly
bowl.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: We were bowling along at about 90 miles per hour.
